questiontext.text:
Find the eigenvalues and the associated eigenvectors of the following matrix:

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}-1 &-6 \\-7 &-1\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Calculate upto 3 significant figures and answer in increasing order $$\small\lambda_{1}\leq\lambda_{2}$$

EigenValues:

$$\small \lambda_{1} = $${1:NUMERICAL:=-7.4807:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}  $$\small \lambda_{2} = $${1:NUMERICAL:=5.4807:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

Associated EigenVectors:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}v_{1,1}\\v_{1,2}\end{pmatrix}\:$$   $$\small V_{2} = k_2\begin{pmatrix}v_{2,1}\\v_{2,2}\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Specify the answer as a unitory vector where $$\small v_{1,1}$$ and $$\small v_{2,1}$$ are positive. In case $$\small v_{1,1}$$ or $$\small v_{2,1}$$ are negative , you can multiply all the elements of the matrix by -1 to make them positive.If $$\small v_{1,1} = 0$$ or $$\small v_{2,1} = 0$$ then check and make sure that $$\small v_{1,2}$$ or $$\small v_{2,2}$$ is given as positive respectively.

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}$$  
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.67937:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.7338:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
  
   
$$\small V_{2} = k_{2}$$  
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.67937:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=-0.7338:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{2}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{2}$$ is a 2x2 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{2}) = \begin{vmatrix}-1-\lambda &-6 \\-7 &-1-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-7.4807$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =5.4807$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{2})V_{1} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{2})V_{2} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-1 - (-7.4807) &-6 \\-7 &-1 - (-7.4807) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}6.4807 &-6 \\-7 &6.4807\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.67937\\0.7338\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-1 - (5.4807) &-6 \\-7 &-1 - (5.4807) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-6.4807 &-6 \\-7 &-6.4807\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the second eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^{2}}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_2\begin{pmatrix}0.67937\\-0.7338\end{pmatrix}\:$$

In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{2}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{2}$$ is a 2x2 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{2}) = \begin{vmatrix}2-\lambda &-4 \\-8 &2-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-3.6569$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =7.6569$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{2})V_{1} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{2})V_{2} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}2 - (-3.6569) &-4 \\-8 &2 - (-3.6569) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}5.6569 &-4 \\-8 &5.6569\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.57735\\0.8165\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}2 - (7.6569) &-4 \\-8 &2 - (7.6569) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-5.6569 &-4 \\-8 &-5.6569\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the second eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^{2}}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_2\begin{pmatrix}0.57735\\-0.8165\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{2}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{2}$$ is a 2x2 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{2}) = \begin{vmatrix}5-\lambda &8 \\10 &-5-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-10.247$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =10.247$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{2})V_{1} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{2})V_{2} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}5 - (-10.247) &8 \\10 &-5 - (-10.247) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}15.247 &8 \\10 &5.247\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.46462\\-0.88551\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}5 - (10.247) &8 \\10 &-5 - (10.247) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-5.247 &8 \\10 &-15.247\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the second eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^{2}}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_2\begin{pmatrix}0.83619\\0.54843\end{pmatrix}\:$$

generalfeedback.text:
In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{2}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{2}$$ is a 2x2 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{2}) = \begin{vmatrix}-1-\lambda &3 \\-4 &-8-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-5$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =-4$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{2})V_{1} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{2})V_{2} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-1 - (-5) &3 \\-4 &-8 - (-5) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}4 &3 \\-4 &-3\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.6\\-0.8\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-1 - (-4) &3 \\-4 &-8 - (-4) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}3 &3 \\-4 &-4\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the second eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^{2}}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_2\begin{pmatrix}0.70711\\-0.70711\end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-5.6235$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =4.6235$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{2})V_{1} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{2})V_{2} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-8 - (-5.6235) &10 \\-3 &7 - (-5.6235) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-2.3765 &10 \\-3 &12.6235\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.9729\\0.23121\end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-8 - (4.6235) &10 \\-3 &7 - (4.6235) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-12.6235 &10 \\-3 &2.3765\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the second eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^{2}}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_2\begin{pmatrix}0.62095\\0.78385\end{pmatrix}\:$$

In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{2}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{2}$$ is a 2x2 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{2}) = \begin{vmatrix}1-\lambda &2 \\-8 &-8-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-5.5616$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =-1.4384$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{2})V_{1} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{2})V_{2} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}1 - (-5.5616) &2 \\-8 &-8 - (-5.5616) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}6.5616 &2 \\-8 &-2.4384\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.29156\\-0.95655\end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}2.4384 &2 \\-8 &-6.5616\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the second eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^{2}}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_2\begin{pmatrix}0.63417\\-0.77319\end{pmatrix}\:$$

In order to find the eigenvalues we look at characteristic equation $$\small det(A - \lambda I_{2}) = 0$$ where $$\small I_{2}$$ is a 2x2 identity matrix]

$$\small det(A - \lambda I_{2}) = \begin{vmatrix}-5-\lambda &-6 \\-7 &-2-\lambda\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

Solving the determinant we get ,

$$\small \lambda_{1} =-10.1521$$  $$\small \lambda_{2} =3.1521$$

The associated eigenvectors can be calculated as follows:

$$\small (A - \lambda_{1} I_{2})V_{1} = 0$$  and  $$\small (A - \lambda_{2} I_{2})V_{2} = 0$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{1}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-5 - (-10.1521) &-6 \\-7 &-2 - (-10.1521) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}5.1521 &-6 \\-7 &8.1521\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{1,1} \\v_{1,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the first eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{1,1} = \frac{v_{1,1}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

$$\small v_{1,2} = \frac{v_{1,2}}{\sqrt{v_{1,1}^{2} + v_{1,2}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{1}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{1} = k_{1}\begin{pmatrix}0.75868\\0.65146\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Putting the corresponding value for $$\small \lambda_{2}$$ we get,

$$\small \begin{bmatrix}-5 - (3.1521) &-6 \\-7 &-2 - (3.1521) \end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \begin{bmatrix}-8.1521 &-6 \\-7 &-5.1521\end{bmatrix}\:.\begin{bmatrix}v_{2,1} \\v_{2,2}\end{bmatrix}\: = 0$$

Solving the equation we get the second eigenvector but in order to make to unitory we proceed as follows,

$$\small v_{2,1} = \frac{v_{2,1}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^{2}}} $$

$$\small v_{2,2} = \frac{v_{2,2}}{\sqrt{v_{2,1}^{2} + v_{2,2}^2}} $$

So, The unitory eigenvector corresponding to $$\small \lambda_{2}$$  can be written as:

$$\small V_{2} = k_2\begin{pmatrix}0.59276\\-0.80538\end{pmatrix}\:$$
